intro: Heteranthocidium isidrense, commonly known as the Isidrense heteranthocidium, is a rare and specialized plant species found in specific microhabitats. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant exhibits unique floral morphology, with heteromorphic flowers that differ in size and structure between staminate and pistillate types. Its leaves are finely dissected, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically fragile species.
